sentence.Network_en: Officials were self-congratulatory about how well the day had gone.
sentence.Network_cn: 官员们对那一天的顺利度过自鸣得意。

sentence.Network_en: Scores of congratulatory telegrams and letters greeted Franklin on his return.
sentence.Network_cn: 富兰克林一回来，就收到了好几十封贺电和贺信。

sentence.Network_en: He sent Kim a congratulatory letter.

PerfectNetExp.abs: congratulator 祝贺者congratulatory 庆祝的congregant 聚会者
*congratulatory adj. 祝贺的congratulation n. 　(congratulations 用来向人祝贺，且只能用复数).
a congratulatory telegram ; the usual congratulatory crowd was conspicuously absent ; a gratulatory address ., 贺电 ; 通常表示祝贺的人明显都是心不在焉的 ; 贺词.

list.abs: 花篮: congratulatory basket后劲: ability to make further advance跑官: take unethical steps to get an important government position内耗: unnecessary losses due.
祝,祝字的解释,查字典 ... 祝愿[ wish] 祝词[ congratulatory speech] 祝祷[ pray].
honky的意思中文翻译 ... congratulatory 庆祝的, 祝贺的 congratulatory message 贺电, 贺信 congregant 聚会者, 召集人.
献,献字的解释,查字典 ... 献谄[ ingratiate oneself with sb.] 献词[ congratulatory message] 献花[ present fresh flowers].

example.ex: He sent Kim a congratulatory letter.

means.word_mean: 1. expressive of sympathetic pleasure or joy on account of someone's success or good fortune;

sentences.sentence: "the usual congratulatory crowd was conspicuously absent"

auth_sentence.content: It wasn't just self-congratulatory laughter at a high-brow joke.

sentences.en: The congratulatory message was designed for political effect.
sentences.cn: 发出这份贺电是出于政治方面的原因。
